HTML Forms Previous Next An HTML form is used to collect user input. The user input is most often sent to a server for processing. Example First name: Last name: Try it Yourself The
Element The HTML element is used to create an HTML form for user input: . form elements .
The
element is a container for different types of input elements, such as: text fields, checkboxes, radio buttons, submit buttons, etc. All the different form elements are covered in this chapter: HTML Form Elements . The Element The HTML element is the most used form element. An element can be displayed in many ways, depending on the type attribute. Here are some examples: Type Description Displays a single-line text input field Displays a radio button (for selecting one of many choices) Displays a checkbox (for selecting zero or more of many choices) Displays a submit button (for submitting the form) Displays a clickable button All the different input types are covered in this chapter: HTML Input Types .
